summary: This bill, the "Stress Testing Accountability and Transparency Act," mandates the Federal Reserve Board to establish clear methodologies for stress testing bank holding companies, preventing double-counting of capital requirements. It requires the Board to publicly disclose stress test scenarios at least 30 days beforehand. Furthermore, the bill prohibits climate-related stress tests for nonbank financial companies and mandates the Government Accountability Office (GAO) to conduct triennial reviews of the stress tests' effectiveness.
